image.altText: Three SES crew members stand before a flooded bridge where a ute is stuck and a hay bale floats by

props.synopsis: The death toll has risen to four and 50,000 remain isolated as floods hammer the NSW Mid North Coast. Follow live.

title.children: Man killed after car swept into floodwaters, nearly 6,000 remain without power

image.altText: A woman and man posting and smiling for photographing

props.synopsis: International tensions over antisemitism erupt after the shooting deaths of two Israeli embassy staff at a Jewish museum in Washington DC.

title.children: Israeli leaders blame Europe after embassy staff shot dead in US

image.altText: David Littleproud speaking at a press conference as Nationals leader Michael McCormack looks on

props.synopsis: Former Nationals leader Michael McCormack says he is "ambitious" for David Littleproud when asked if he would have his full support. Follow live.

title.children: 'I'm ambitious for him': McCormack's Morrison-era warning for Littleproud

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'I'm ambitious for him', McCormack says of David Littleproud's future
Michael McCormack spoke to Liberal leader Sussan Ley after Coalition breakdown
PM Anthony Albanese travels to flood affected NSW

image.altText: Gates of Harvard University in America

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has revoked Harvard University's ability to enrol international students in its escalating battle with the Ivy League school, saying thousands of current students must transfer to other schools or leave the country.

title.children: Australian embassy monitoring as White House bars Harvard's foreign students

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is charged with murdering three relatives by serving them a beef Wellington meal that contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Erin Patterson murder trial hears from intensive care specialist

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gail Patterson arrives at the Austin
Doctor recalls Don Patterson arriving at hospital

image.altText: Susan Ley at lectern with hands together pointing forward

props.synopsis: David Littleproud had a last-minute change of heart yesterday about detonating the alliance with the Liberals, but insists his four policy demands must be "ratified" before the partnership can resume.

title.children: Turnbull says 'stupid' Nats picking 'fight over nothing' as Libs meet today

image.altText: A woman with a flower fascinator hugging her taller daugher

props.synopsis: The mother of missing Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop says the "numbness" the family is feeling is "eating at us", as police continue their investigation.

title.children: Mother shares anguish one week on from Pheobe's disappearance

image.altText: A young boy holding a plastic bag full of flatbreads.

props.synopsis: Israel says it has allowed 100 aid trucks into the enclave, home to more than 2 million Palestinians, amid growing concerns about a humanitarian crisis.

title.children: Gaza blockade eases amid warnings more aid is needed to avoid famine

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: New Zealand is opening a series of charter schools and giving them "considerable flexibility" when it comes to the curriculum, but education scholars point to the US as they warn against the policy.

title.children: Why NZ is embracing a controversial school system rejected by Australia

image.altText: A satellite image of a new North Korean warship at harbour before entering the water.

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un's public condemnation of the bungled warship launch was a rare admission of failure from inside North Korea, but experts say it says a lot about its bigger plans.

title.children: What an admission of failure says about North Korea's nuclear ambitions

image.altText: Three white crosses overlay an outback landscape with red rocky cliffs, dry grass, and expansive plains under a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The tension that defined Christmas Creek for generations begins to unravel with a single act, one that could end a painful colonial legacy in remote WA.

title.children: Families denied cemetery access for decades see hope with simple gesture

image.altText: Three women looking out over the bay.

props.synopsis: The Port of Brisbane has been accused of breaching its obligations under federal guidelines by failing to engage with a local Aboriginal group over its plan to dredge Moreton Bay, denying any wrongdoing.

title.children: 'It will destroy us': Concerns over plans to dredge Moreton Bay

image.altText: heavy dark clouds and rain cover over sydney

props.synopsis: The heaviest falls on Friday will be concentrated around Sydney in the morning, before shifting to the South Coast, and could produce a months' worth of rain in just a few hours.

title.children: Flood watch shifts to Sydney and South Coast

image.altText: A man in sunglasses, a hat, jumper and shorts stands on the roof of a home.

props.synopsis: Just hours after her family were airlifted from their roof with floodwaters swelling below, Seeanna Briscoe was preparing for another double shift at Taree Hospital.

title.children: 'I don't think anyone is coming': Family's anxious roof wait for flood help

image.altText: A representation of virtual currency Bitcoin and US banknotes.

props.synopsis: Local shares rise after a fairly flat finish on Wall Street, after US government bond yields eased off early highs. Bitcoin reached a fresh peak. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises, Bitcoin hits fresh high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ACCC targets scammers offering fake jobs
ASX on the rise as energy gains
ASX makes modest gain in early trade

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on, surrounded by flowers.

props.synopsis: A display of Australian Great Sun Orchids at London's Chelsea Flower Show is awarded a gold medal by the Royal Horticultural Society's notoriously strict judging team.

title.children: Aussie orchid turns heads with gold at world's most prestigious flower show

image.altText: A man wearing a black leather jacket takes a drag of a cigarette

props.synopsis: Rapper Kid Cudi becomes the latest celebrity to testify at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking trial in New York.

title.children: Kid Cudi says his car was set on fire weeks after Diddy broke into his home

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Former childcare educators are revealing serious incidents at Affinity Education's Canberra centres, including a case of a baby rolling off a change table.

title.children: 'Toxic': Former Affinity childcare staff say baby fell off change table

image.altText: A person with a contact lens on their finger, about to be placed over their eye.

props.synopsis: Scientists have unveiled contact lenses that allow people to see in the dark by converting normally invisible infrared light into light they can see.

title.children: Scientists invent infrared contacts that let people see through their eyelids

image.altText: Smoke and flames are seen billowing from a house on fire

props.synopsis: Arson and Explosives Squad detectives say they have ruled out the male occupant of a home in the Melbourne suburb of Chadstone as a suspect in the house fire that injured a mother and her children.

title.children: Detectives waiting to interview injured mother over Chadstone house fire

image.altText: Two men stand together with a third man leaning forward with his hands on his knees. One man wears an Irish flag balaclava.

props.synopsis: British police have charged Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh, a member of the Irish rap group Kneecap, with a terrorism offence for allegedly waving a flag in support of Hezbollah at a concert in London. How did we get here?

title.children: Who are Kneecap and why has a member been charged with terrorism?

image.altText: A woman in a sari holds her hand to her chin and smiles

props.synopsis: Jyoti Malhotra was detained on suspicion of being "groomed" by a Pakistani agent known as "Danish", but the influencer's father insists she's innocent.

title.children: The influencer, the spy and the secret messages: Indian vlogger arrested

image.altText: A house with a large hole in it, seen from behind police tape and fire trucks.

props.synopsis: Authorities say multiple homes have been hit, causing a "gigantic debris field" in the Californian neighbourhood.

title.children: Multiple people dead after small plane crashes into San Diego neighbourhood

image.altText: A sad woman and man at a homeless camp

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Basic Rights Queensland argue that the destruction of homeless encampments constitutes a violation of human rights and are testing it in court.

title.children: Human rights lawyers challenge council over homeless camp destructions

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court that her religious beliefs have been "tainted" after she was sexually assaulted as a teenager by a senior member in a South Australian church.

title.children: 14yo girl's sexual abuse by senior SA church member ignored, court hears

image.altText: a retired couple sitting side by side in their living room

props.synopsis: Research shows baby boomers are the fastest-growing demographic of cryptocurrency investors, but experts say it's risky business for retirees.

title.children: Retirees enter millennial crypto domain to chase life-changing gains

image.altText: Vincent Namatjira in a pink shirt in front of MCA

props.synopsis: One of Sydney's landmark buildings, site of the First Fleet landing, will light up tonight with Vincent Namatjira's King Dingo, an irreverent take on colonial power and a tribute to First Nations strength, pride and resilience.

title.children: Namatjira's Vivid projection is his 'most bold and ambitious work'

image.altText: Composite image of Luke Beveridge (left) and Kane Cornes.

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge's tense relationship with commentator Kane Cornes reaches a flashpoint in a heated exchange at Kardinia Park.

title.children: Bulldogs coach Beveridge tight-lipped about Cornes 'confrontation'

image.altText: JJ holding the Eurovision trophy while singing as confetti flutters down

props.synopsis: From Eurovision to Europa League and a federal break-up in between, this week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A federal break-up, Sydney's train pain and the Eurovision grand final

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser says he witnessed first-hand China's willingness to fight a US trade war.

title.children: RBA deputy says China knew it had a 'strong hand' in trade war with US

image.altText: Close up of Anohni's face, she has blonde hair and purple eye shadow

props.synopsis: Whenever Anohni brings her powerful and beautiful voice to Australia, she wants to use it for good.

title.children: Why this artist will never bring her band to Australia again

image.altText: Unidentified man wearing shorts and running shoes in winter outdoor environment.

props.synopsis: The great Tasmanian sport of spotting shorts wearers in winter is fast approaching. But while some people seem impervious to the chill, there are times when even the toughest nuts should put on some pants.

title.children: A BOM forecaster's guide to wearing shorts when it's single digits outside
